info.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Open-Label Study to Evaluate Safety and Preliminary Evidence of Effectiveness of Tumor Ablation With Talaporfin Sodium (LS11) and Interstitial Light Emitting Diodes (LEDs) in the Treatment of Subjects With Inoperable Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)

identified_line.line: * A diagnosis of primary Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC), established by any one of the following criteria in a clinical setting suggestive of HCC: (i) Two different imaging techniques that suggests HCC; (ii) Combination of one imaging technique that suggests HCC and serum alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) level >400 ng/mL; (iii) Histological evidence of HCC;

criterions.exact_snippets: diagnosis of primary Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)
Two different imaging techniques that suggests HCC
Two different imaging techniques that suggests HCC
one imaging technique that suggests HCC
one imaging technique that suggests HCC
serum alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) level >400 ng/mL
Histological evidence of HCC

and_criteria.exact_snippets: diagnosis of primary Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)
Two different imaging techniques that suggests HCC
Two different imaging techniques that suggests HCC
one imaging technique that suggests HCC
one imaging technique that suggests HCC
serum alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) level >400 ng/mL

identified_line.line: * Subjects with at least 1 but no more than 3 lesions in the liver may be considered for enrollment in the study;

criterions.exact_snippets: at least 1 but no more than 3 lesions in the liver

and_criteria.exact_snippets: at least 1 but no more than 3 lesions in the liver

identified_line.line: * Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-2;

criterions.exact_snippets: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-2

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-2

identified_line.line: * Life expectancy of at least 16 weeks;

criterions.exact_snippets: Life expectancy of at least 16 weeks

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Life expectancy of at least 16 weeks

identified_line.line: * Prior treatment failure with locally ablative techniques is allowed. Subjects who were not candidates for surgery, systemic chemotherapy, chemoembolization (TACE), intratumoral ethanol injection (PEI), radiofrequency ablation (RFA), cryoablation or other locally ablative technology may be eligible, but at least 4 weeks must have elapsed since the completion of any prior therapy and the subject must have recovered from acute side effects;

criterions.exact_snippets: Prior treatment failure with locally ablative techniques is allowed.
criterions.criterion: prior treatment failure with locally ablative techniques

criterions.exact_snippets: Subjects who were not candidates for surgery, systemic chemotherapy, chemoembolization (TACE), intratumoral ethanol injection (PEI), radiofrequency ablation (RFA), cryoablation or other locally ablative technology may be eligible
at least 4 weeks must have elapsed since the completion of any prior therapy
criterions.criterion: time since completion of prior therapy

criterions.exact_snippets: the subject must have recovered from acute side effects

identified_line.line: * 18 years of age or more;

criterions.exact_snippets: 18 years of age or more

and_criteria.exact_snippets: 18 years of age or more

identified_line.line: * Adequate hematologic, liver and renal functions as evidenced by the following: *WBC > 2,400/mm; *Platelet Count > 75,000/µl; *Hemoglobin > 9.4 gm/dL; *PT and PTT < 1.5 Control; *AST, ALT < 5 x ULN; *Bilirubin < 1.5 X ULN; *Alk Phos < 3X ULN; *Creatinine < 2.5 mg/dL (SI: 221 mmol/L)

criterions.exact_snippets: WBC > 2,400/mm
Platelet Count > 75,000/µl
Hemoglobin > 9.4 gm/dL
PT and PTT < 1.5 Control
AST, ALT < 5 x ULN
Bilirubin < 1.5 X ULN
Alk Phos < 3X ULN
Creatinine < 2.5 mg/dL (SI: 221 mmol/L)

identified_line.line: * Any concurrent disease or condition that in the opinion of the investigator impairs the subject's ability to complete the trial. Psychological, familial, sociological, geographical or medical conditions which in the Principal Investigator's opinion could compromise compliance with the objectives and procedures of this protocol or obscure interpretation of the trial's data.

criterions.exact_snippets: Any concurrent disease or condition that in the opinion of the investigator impairs the subject's ability to complete the trial.

Psychological, familial, sociological, geographical or medical conditions which in the Principal Investigator's opinion could compromise compliance with the objectives and procedures of this protocol or obscure interpretation of the trial's data.
criterions.criterion: conditions affecting compliance or data interpretation
